access.notes: WordPress page behind Cloudflare; all content server-rendered. EHI export spec PDFs are at the bottom of a multi-product compliance hub. No JavaScript, login, or anti-bot issues.

export_format.description: Individual patient export produces pipe-delimited ("|") flat text with typed record rows (Type 10=demographics, 20=orders, 30=accessions, etc.). Patient population export produces HL7 v2.3 or v2.5.1 messages via TCP/IP or to a file, using the site's existing results interface formatter. No mention of ZIP packaging or folder structure.

documentation.notes: 12 record types documented in the Individual Export Spec (Types 0, 1, 10-15, 20, 30, 40, 50, 55, 56, 60, 65, 66). Field positions and descriptions are provided, but no formal data types (numeric, varchar, etc.) are specified. The Population Export Spec is mostly an HL7 interface configuration template, not a data dictionary.

clinical.evidence: Lab results (Type 60/65/66), test components (Type 50), order codes (Type 40), blood bank reaction results (Types 55/56). This is a laboratory information system; clinical data is lab-specific.

secure_messages.evidence: Searched for message/inbox/communication/chat/portal/correspondence — not found. LIS does not handle patient messaging.

billing_financial.evidence: Type 20 field 9: 'Special Billing Code'; Type 40 field 26: 'CPT Code(s)'; Type 50 field 8: 'CPT Code'; Type 20 field 15: 'Patient Account'. Limited billing data — charge codes but no amounts, claims, or payment records.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Searched for insurance/coverage/eligibility/authorization/payer/carrier/benefit/plan — not found in export specifications.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Searched for appointment/schedule/booking — not found. LIS does not manage appointments. Ordering data (Type 20) captures when orders were placed but not scheduling.

documents_images.evidence: Searched for document/image/attachment/scan/fax/DICOM — not found. Export is structured data only.

audit_trails.evidence: Searched for audit/access/tracking/who viewed — not found in export specifications. The system has auditable events per 170.315(d)(2) certification, but audit data is not included in the EHI export.

lab_data.evidence: Core domain. Complete lab workflow: orders (Type 20), accessions (Type 30), order codes with LOINC (Type 40), test components (Type 50), blood bank reactions (Types 55/56), result history (Type 60), numeric/comment/freetext results (Type 65), microbiology susceptibility (Type 66).

blood_bank.evidence: Types 11-14: Antigen/Antibody data, Problems, Comments, Transfusion Attributes. Types 55/56: Blood Bank Reaction Results at test and phase level. Type 10 includes ABO, Rh, number of transfusions, date of last transfusion.

patient_demographics.evidence: Type 10: Hospital, Patient Name, DOB, Sex, SSN, ABO, Rh. Type 15: Linked MRN list. Limited demographic set appropriate for an LIS.

downloaded_files.curl_command: curl -L -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o Patient-Data-Export-Specification.pdf 'https://www.clinisys.com/app/uploads/2023/11/Patient-Data-Export-Specification.pdf'

curl -L -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o Patient-Population-Export-Specification.pdf 'https://www.clinisys.com/app/uploads/2023/11/Patient-Population-Export-Specification.pdf'

curl -L -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o Compliance-Certificate-SQ-Lab-v2024.pdf 'https://www.clinisys.com/app/uploads/2025/09/Compliance-Certificate-SQ-Lab-v2024-022625.pdf'

curl -L -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o Compliance-Certificate-Sunquest-Laboratory-v7.pdf 'https://www.clinisys.com/app/uploads/2024/06/Compliance-Certificate-Sunquest-Laboratory-v7-060324.pdf'

issues: Documentation is very minimal — Individual Patient Export Spec is only 5 pages with basic field position listings, no data types or value sets.

Patient Population Export Spec (14 pages) is primarily an HL7 interface configuration/signoff template, not a data dictionary. It documents the process for setting up the export interface, not the exported data content.
No developer guide or tools for reading/processing exports.
No schema definition (DDL, JSON Schema, XSD) — just prose descriptions of pipe-delimited field positions.
Some fields note 'will need translation' (e.g., Specimen Code in Type 30) without providing the translation tables or value sets.
Export scope is limited to laboratory data only (expected for an LIS), but the documentation doesn't explicitly state what data domains are excluded.
SQ Lab v2024 product section has no separate b(10) EHI Export documentation — it appears to share the same export specs as the Sunquest Laboratory versions.
No insurance, appointments, documents/images, secure messages, or audit trail data in the export — these domains don't apply to a laboratory system.
summary: Clinisys provides two EHI export specifications for their Sunquest Laboratory / SQ Lab products. The Individual Patient Export produces pipe-delimited text files with 12+ record types covering patient demographics, blood bank data, lab orders, accessions, test components, and results (including blood bank reactions and microbiology susceptibility). The Patient Population Export uses HL7 v2.3/v2.5.1 messages via the existing results interface. Documentation is minimal (5-page and 14-page PDFs) with field-level descriptions but no data types, value sets, or sample exports. As a laboratory information system, the export scope is appropriately limited to lab domain data — no insurance, appointments, messaging, documents, or audit trails.
